alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:55PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Houston and Jackson Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 355 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Graceville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Graceville, Marianna, Dothan, Ashford, Cowarts, Malone, Cottondale, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Avon, Madrid, Gordon, Campbellton, Bascom, Memphis, Crosby, Grangeburg, Wilson Mill and Southern Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
